newsitem.title: GERMANY: Merged Bavarian bank seeks top credit rating.
newsitem.headline: Merged Bavarian bank seeks top credit rating.

text.p: The head of Bayersiche Vereinsbank said on Tuesday that the new bank resulting from the merger between Vereinsbank and Bayerische Hypotheken- und Wechsel-Bank should get a top rating.
Vereinsbank management board chairman Albrecht Schmidt an annoucement that U.S. rating agency Moody's would examine Vereinsbank's ratings.
Moody's said it would be examining ratings after the news on Monday that Vereinsbank would merge with Hypo-Bank into a German banking giant second only to Deutsche Bank AG.
Schmidt also welcomed Moody's announcement that it had left its rating of Vereinsbank mortgage bonds unchanged at AAA.

The importance of the merger between the two Bavarian banks meant that an examination of ratings was necessary, Schmidt said, and Vereinsbank would do everything to convince Moody's of the quality of the new bank.
The new bank resulting from the merger "deserves the same good rating that Vereinsbank has enjoyed until now," he said.
